meta_desc: Parag Parikh Flexi Cap Fund Direct Growth is Flexi Cap Equity mutual fund with risk-reward rating of 5/10. It has track record of 11 years, with three year return of 18.32. Risk is Very High
scheme_name: Parag Parikh Flexi Cap Fund Direct Growth
fund_manager: Raunak Onkar, Rajeev Thakkar, Raj Mehta
exit_load: For units above 10% of the investment, exit load of 2% if redeemed within 365 days and 1% if redeemed after 365 days but on or before 730 days.
description: The scheme aims to achieve long-term capital appreciation by investing primarily in equity and equity related instruments.

amc_info.name: PPFAS Mutual Fund
amc_info.address: 81/82, 8th Floor, Sakhar Bhavan,Ramnath Goenka Marg,230 Nariman Point Mumbai 400021
amc_info.description: PPFAS Mutual Fund started their mutual fund on 10/10/2012 and its managing total assets of â‚¹821 Cr. Its ranked at 34 as per total assets at end of 30th Sep 2017.
amc_info.more_description:
Parag Parikh Asset Management was launched on 10th October 2012 an is promoted by arag Parikh Financial Advisory Services Pvt. Ltd, a financial advisory firm incorporated in 1992. The mission of this mutual fund is to provide prudent fund management so that investors can attain their long-term financial goals.

The tagline of the company is 'There's only one right way'. They believe in simplifying the process of investing for their clients and that is their main motive.

It provides a host of mutual funds to investors and they also invest in various schemes across different market capitalization.Their simplistic way of managing funds and providing transparent service to investors makes them popular in the mutual fund industry.

category_info.category_helper_text: Invests in stocks as per Contrarian investment strategy
category_info.tax_impact: If you redeem within one year, returns are taxed at 20%. If you redeem after one year, returns exceeding Rs 1.25 lakh in a financial year are taxed at 12.5%.
category_info.description: Contra funds follow Contrarian strategy which means investing in stocks in contrast to the prevailing sentiment. Minimum investment in equity is 65%.
